thread.title: MAC Football 2015: Week 7 by the numbers show lots of offense (photos)
thread.title_full: MAC Football 2015: Week 7 by the numbers show lots of offense (photos) | cleveland.com

author: Plain Dealer Sports
title: MAC Football 2015: Week 7 by the numbers show lots of offense (photos)
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Mid-American Conference football teams continue to put up some impressive offensive numbers, even as several teams in the league rank among the NCAA leaders in defense.
Here's a look at some of the superlative numbers after Week 6:
4 – Number of wins by MAC teams over 'Power Five' Conference opponents, beating Arkansas (SEC), Iowa State (Big-12), Maryland (Big Ten) and Purdue (Big Ten).
5 – Number of touchdown passes by quarterback Matt Johnson in Bowling Green's win over Akron. It was his second straight five-TD performance and the third time he's had five or more. He had five touchdowns vs. UMass and Akron and six at Maryland.
7 – Number of interceptions this season by Northern Illinois sophomore defensive back Shawun Lurry, the most in the FBS. Pick No. 7 set up Huskies running back Joel Bouagnon's 53-yard touchdown run in a 45-12 win at Miami. Lurry has intercepted a pass in five straight games, dating back to September 19, and has interceptions in six of seven games this season.
9.8 – Average yards per carry by Western Michigan vs. Ohio.
12 – Number of victories the MAC has earned vs. FBS non-conference opponents, which ranks third most going back to 2000. The MAC's top two years for FBS non-conference wins came in 2012 (16) and 2008 (14).
44 – Consecutive games with a pass reception by Toledo wide receiver Alonzo Russell , which ranks second in the country, followed by UMass wideout Tajae Sharpe (41 games), who is third. Northern Illinois wide receiver Tommylee Lewis (34 games) ranks tied for fourth and Ball State wide receiver Jordan Williams ranks tied for 10th (31 games).
49 – Margin of victory in Bowling Green's 59-10 win over Akron, the largest margin of victory for the Falcons in series history. Bowling Green has now beat Akron in seven straight contests.
56 ­ - Toledo scored 56 unanswered points to defeat Eastern Michigan, 63-20. The 63-point output was a season-high and the most in a regular-season game since a 66-63 win over Western Michigan in 2011.
77 – Number of MAC coaching victories by Ohio's Frank Solich, which is tied for fourth all-time with former Bowling Green coach Doyt Perry. Next up is former Marshall coach Bob Pruett with 79. The leader is Herb Deromedi of Central Michigan with 110 from 1978-93.
430 - Total yards rushing by Western Michigan, including 404 in the second half, in a 49-14 win at Ohio. It is the most in the MAC this season and 11th most in the nation. Broncos running backs Jamauri Bogan (135) and LeVante Bellamy (149) teamed to become the first Bronco players to have over 100 yards rushing in the same game since 2013.
532 – Total yards gain by Bowling Green on 75 plays (7.1 yards per play) against Akron.
2,891 – Number of yards passing for Bowling Green's Matt Johnson this season, which ranks ninth on the all-time list at BG after just six games.
